description: The test tempest.api.compute.servers.test_list_server_filters:ListServerFiltersTestXML.test_list_servers_filtered_by_ip_regex tries to search a server with only a fragment of its IP (GET http://XX/v2/$Tenant/servers?ip=10.0.) which calls the following Quantum request : http://XX/v2.0/ports.json?fixed_ips=ip_address%3D10.0. But it seems this regex search is not supporter by Quantum. Thus the tempest test fauls.
title: List servers matching a regex fails with Neutron

comments.content: The test tempest.api.compute.servers.test_list_server_filters:ListServerFiltersTestXML.test_list_servers_filtered_by_ip_regex tries to search a server with only a fragment of its IP (GET http://XX/v2/$Tenant/servers?ip=10.0.) which calls the following Quantum request : http://XX/v2.0/ports.json?fixed_ips=ip_address%3D10.0. But it seems this regex search is not supporter by Quantum. Thus the tempest test fauls.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jordan-pittier

comments.content: If one would implement a "search port by IP with regex" feature, I think the best place to hack it would be in file quantum/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py::_get_ports_query()
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jordan-pittier

comments.content: I will use a BP to do it since it involves much.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~gongysh

comments.content: because this is a Quantum gap with the nova-network API I'm going to call it confirmed, but it's a quantum bug.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content: This is a blocking issue for full tempest runs of Quantum.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/38600
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
